name: Mexican Chicken and Black Bean Salad
author: dian
summary: I call this diet haters' diet food because simple substitutions mean you won't feel deprived.  You shouldn't miss the tortilla chips because you have delicious black beans instead, and you still get the yummy spicy Mexican flavor and cheese. While not necessarily authentic, this salad is easy to make!  If you have time, it's is also wonderful topped with onions and maybe fresh jalapenos.
ingredients: 2 (4 ounce) frozen skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
1 (8 ounce) can low sodium tomato sauce
½ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend
directions: Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C)
Place the chicken breasts in the prepared dish
Mix the tomato sauce, water and   in a small bowl; pour sauce over the chicken
Bake in preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 30 minutes
Place the chicken breasts on the spinach beds and spoon half the black beans over each piece
Divide sour cream, shredded cheese and salsa to top each salad
